BNC User Reference Guide

<particDesc>

particDesc (participation description) describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in a linguistic interaction.
Class model.profileDescPart att.declarable
Declaration 
element particDesc { attribute n { text }?, person+ }
Attributes
(In addition to global attributes and those inherited from [att.declarable ] )
n in demographic texts, supplies the respondent number used to identify the batch of tapes.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) text
Example
 <particDesc n="C114"
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <person
    ageGroup="Ag4"
    xml:id="PS1US"
    role="unspecified"
    sex="m"
    soc="UU"
    dialect="NONE"
    educ="X">
   <age>45</age>
   <persName>Terry</persName>
   <occupation>british rail employee</occupation>
  </person>...</particDesc>
Note

The respondent number is also used to identify the tapes deposited with the British Library's sound archive.
; ;
Module corpus
